intro: Gymnostachyum pubescens, commonly known as the hairy gymnostachyum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Gymnostachyum pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
